name: Hot Sausage and Bean Dip
author: Amber
summary: My mother used to make this dip for me when I was a kid and it was always one of my favorites. This is a very quick and easy recipe for guests and it is always a crowd pleaser. I usually serve this with Fritos® Scoops!® chips.
ingredients: 1 pound bulk spicy sausage (such as Bob Evans®)
1 (11.5 ounce) can bean with bacon soup
½ cup shredded Cheddar cheese, or to taste
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Heat a skillet over medium heat
Break sausage into small pieces and add to the skillet; cook and stir until completely browned, 5 to 7 minutes
Stir bean with bacon soup and sour cream together in a bowl; pour over browned sausage and stir
Transfer mixture to a baking dish; top with Cheddar cheese
Bake in preheated oven until the cheese is bubbly and the dip is hot throughout, about 10 minutes
